info.title: MobilePacketCoreManagementClient
info.description: The definitions in this swagger specification will be used for the Mobile Packet Core resource.

put.description: Creates or updates a Mobile Packet Core

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to create or update a mobile packet core object

200.description: Creates/Updates the Mobile Packet Core resource.

201.description: Creates/Updates the Mobile Packet Core resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get information about the specified Mobile Packet Core

200.description: Retrieves the Mobile Packet Core resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes the specified Mobile Packet Core.

200.description: Deletes the Mobile Packet Core resource.

202.description: Accepted. Sets 'Deleting' provisioningState until the operation completes. Returns an operation URI that can be queried to find the current state of the operation.

204.description: Request is successful. Resource with the specified name does not exist.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the update device tags operation.

200.description: Update Mobile Packet Core resource Tag.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Continue a safe deployment rollout.  This is used when the 'manual' continuation policy is used for safe deployment rollouts between groups.  If the safe deployment rollout is not waiting for user input, this action has no effect

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Perform a 'what-if' operation on the specified snapshot to show what operations would be taken if the snapshot were activated.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Perform a 'what-if' operation to validate the current set of resources as if a snapshot were to be created

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists all the mobile packet cores in a subscription.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a list of mobile packet core resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists all the mobile packet cores in a resource group.

200.description: Request is successful. The operation returns a list of component resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

supportedType.description: Whether to use the N26 interface for interworking between 4G and 5G.  AMF

snssai.description: Default S-NSSAI value to be used for EPC interworking.  AMF

fallback.description: Controls support for fallback for emergency services.  AMF

emergencyUserOption.description: User category to allow an emergency call. AMF

skipAuthentication.description: Skip authentication for UEs requesting emergency services. AMF

ueAmbrUplink.description: Emergency uplink Aggregated Maximum Bit Rate (AMBR). Unit: kbps.  AMF

ueAmbrDownlink.description: Emergency downlink Aggregated Maximum Bit Rate (AMBR). Unit: kbps.  AMF

snssai.description: S-NSSAI value to be used for emergency calls.  AMF

PfcpProfile.description: Profile used for PFCP Associations.  SMF, UPF

pfcpAssociationRetryInterval.description: PFCP Association Retry Interval - amount of time to wait before re-initiating Association (ms).

pfcpSessionResponseTimeout.description: PFCP Session Response Timeout Value - amount of time to wait before retransmitting a session level message (ms)

pfcpSessionRetransmitCount.description: PFCP Session Retransmit Count - number of session level messages retransmissions to make before declaring timeout

pfcpNodeResponseTimeout.description: PFCP Node Response Timeout Value - amount of time to wait before retransmitting a node level message (ms)

pfcpNodeRetransmitCount.description: PFCP Node Retransmit Count - number of node level messages retransmissions to make before declaring a timeout

pfcpHeartbeatPeriodicInterval.description: PFCP HeartBeat Periodic Interval - amount of time to wait before retransmitting a heartbeat request (ms)

pfcpHeartbeatDownThreshold.description: PFCP HeartBeat Down Threshold - amount of pfcp-heartbeat-periodic-intervals after which the association will be restarted, 0 means retry heartbeat indefinitely, operator can set it accordingly.

pfcpGuardTimeInterval.description: PFCP Guard Time Interval - amount of time to wait before tearing down Association (ms)

GtpcProfile.description: Profile used for GTP Interfaces.  AMF, SMF, UPF

echoInterval.description: echo-interval in minutes. Use value 0 for disabling this behavior

n3EchoRequest.description: n3-echo-request : number of attempts to send echo request message (1 - 20)

inactivityTimer.description: time in minutes to wait after GTP path failure for a peer (1 - 36000)

t3PathRecoveryEchoResponse.description: time in milliseconds after which GtpcAgent sends echo requests to a previously failed peer.  0 indicates disabled.  Values 1-99 are invalid

DnsProfile.description: Profile used for interfacing with DNS.  AMF

mobilityManagement.description: Event Data Record Profile for Mobility Management events.  AMF

name.description: Event layer name - predefined set of supported event layers
Event type name - predefined set of supported event types

items.description: outcome type name - predefined set of supported outcomes

sessionManagement.description: Event Data Record Profile for Session Management events.  SMF

name.description: Event type name - predefined set of supported event types

items.description: outcome type name - predefined set of supported outcomes

userPlane.description: Event Data Record Profile for User Plane events.  UPF

startFlowEventDataRecordGeneration.description: Enable or Disable START type Flow Event Data Record generation

interimFlowEventDataRecordGeneration.description: Enable or Disable INTERIM type Flow Event Data Record generation

stopFlowEventDataRecordGeneration.description: Enable or Disable STOP type Flow Event Data Record generation

interimEventDataRecordInterval.description: time interval between two successive interim data records in seconds

optimizedInterimRecords.description: List of Event Data Record types for which interim record optimization is enabled. if enabled, interim record size is optimized by skipping fields that did not change from last Event Data Record and incremental stats

ipv4AddressPrimary.description: Primary IPv4 address of the node

ipv4AddressSecondary.description: Secondary IPv4 address of the node - only applicable if primary IPv4 address is specified

ipv6AddressPrimary.description: Primary IPv6 address of the node

ipv6AddressSecondary.description: Secondary IPv6 address of the node - only applicable if primary IPv6 address is specified

probability.description: Probability of sampling the trace for the target

sessionId.description: ID to uniquely identify the trace session. Format: PLMN.trace_id, where PLMN is input as 5 or 6 digit BCD number and trace-id is input as a 3 byte hexadecimal number. Example: 310070.70F13A

items.description: must count(./supi)!=0 or count(./dnn)!=0 or count(./pei)!=0 or count(./gpsi)!=0

probability.description: Probability of sampling the trace for SMF

supi.description: Subscription Permanent Identifier (SUPI) value to match traces

pei.description: Permanent Equipment Identifier (PEI) value to match traces

gpsi.description: Generic Public Subscription Identifier (GPSI) value to match traces

dnn.description: Data Network Name value to match traces

sourceAmfResourceReleaseTimer.description: Defines the duration the source AMF waits before releasing the UE context; The timer is started after UE context transfer request is received from target AMF; Default: 10000; Unit: milliseconds

nchfProfile.description: Nchf service based interface profile.  SMF

failoverStatusCodes.description: The set of HTTP status codes received for which the Nchf request needs to be failed over to an alternate CHF server

restrictedServerExpiryInterval.description: Duration in seconds after which the CHF Server can be considered to be available for sending the Nchf requests to it.

reachabilityFailuresPercentage.description: The percentage of Nchf request failures within a duration defined by reachability-failures-duration configuration, after which the server is restricted.

reachabilityFailuresDuration.description: The duration in seconds which is considered to monitor the percentage of Nchf request failures, defined by the reachability-failures-percentage, to check if given CHF server needs to be restricted or not.

nnrfProfile.description: Nnrf service based interface profile.  AMF, UPF, SMF, NSSF

subscriptionValidityTimer.description: Validity time which the subscription is desired to be kept alive. Default: 31680; Unit: minutes

heartbeatInterval.description: Heartbeat duration interval value in seconds. Default: 120

responseTimeout.description: Time period (in milliseconds) to wait for response after a request has been sent, after which it will be treated as no response from peer.  SMF

includeTrackingAreaIdentifiersInNrfRegis.description: Determines if the TAI list needs to be included in the network function Registration request (as defined by TS 29.510 section 5.2.2.2.2) sent to NRF. AMF

namfProfile.description: Namf service based interface profile.  AMF, SMF

responseTimeout.description: Time period (in milliseconds) to wait for response after a request has been sent, after which it will be treated as no response from peer.  SMF

requestTimer.description: Defines the duration the AMF waits for a response from the peer; Unit: milliseconds.  AMF

responseTimeout.description: Time period (in milliseconds) to wait for response after a request has been sent, after which it will be treated as no response from peer.  SMF

sourceAmfResourceReleaseTimer.description: Defines the duration the source AMF waits before releasing the UE context; The timer is started after UE context transfer request is received from target AMF; Unit: milliseconds.  AMF

includeSecurityAnchorFunctionData.description: On the Source AMF, this controls whether the source AMF includes security context information in the form of Security Anchor Function data in the UE Context Transfer response. On the Target AMF, this controls whether the Security Anchor Function data is expected in the response. The UE Context Transfer service operation is described in TS 29.518. A value of 'always' is compliant to Release 15 and prior. A value of 'exclude-when-ue-validated' is compliant to Release 16.  AMF

nausfProfile.description: Nausf service based interface profile.  AMF

authRequestTimer.description: Defines the duration the AMF waits for a response from the peer; Unit: milliseconds.  AMF

authSupportedFeaturesAuthenticationResul.description: Defines if the Authentication result removal procedure should be performed during purge or SMC failure

nudmProfile.description: Nudm service based interface profile.  AMF, SMF

requestTimer.description: Defines the duration the AMF waits for a response from the peer; Unit: milliseconds.  AMF

responseTimeout.description: Time period (in milliseconds) to wait for response after a request has been sent, after which it will be treated as no response from peer.  SMF

requestTimer.description: Defines the duration the AMF waits for a response from the peer; Unit: milliseconds.  AMF

responseTimeout.description: Time period (in milliseconds) to wait for response after a request has been sent, after which it will be treated as no response from peer.  SMF

requestTimer.description: Defines the duration the AMF waits for a response from the peer; Unit: milliseconds.  AMF

nsmfProfile.description: Nsmf service based interface profile.  AMF

pduSessionRequestTimer.description: Defines the duration the AMF waits for a response from the peer; Unit: milliseconds.  AMF

nnssfProfile.description: Nnssf service based interface profile.  AMF

networkSliceSelectionRequestTimer.description: Defines the duration the AMF waits for a response from the peer; Unit: milliseconds.  AMF

nsmsfProfile.description: Nsmsf service based interface profile.  AMF

smsRequestTimer.description: Defines the duration the AMF waits for a response from the peer; Unit: milliseconds.  AMF

npcfProfile.description: Npcf service based interface profile.  AMF, SMF

policyControl.description: Defined parameters for controlling the interface to the PCF

userEquipmentRequestTimer.description: Defines the duration the AMF waits for a response from the peer; Unit: milliseconds.  AMF

accessMobilityRequestTimer.description: Defines the duration the AMF waits for a response from the peer; Unit: milliseconds.  AMF

responseTimeout.description: Time period (in milliseconds) to wait for response after a request has been sent, after which it will be treated as no response from peer.  SMF

nlmfProfile.description: Nlmf service based interface profile.  AMF

requestTimer.description: Defines the duration the AMF waits for a response from the peer; Unit: milliseconds.  AMF

ngmlcProfile.description: Ngmlc service based interface profile.  AMF

requestTimer.description: Defines the duration the AMF waits for a response from the peer; Unit: milliseconds.  AMF

timeToWait.description: Time to wait; the minimum allowed waiting time after a setup or configuration update failure; Default: 60; Unit: seconds

resetAckDelayTimer.description: 5G-AN reset ACK delay timer; Default: 14; Unit: seconds

n2ReleaseDelayTimer.description: Ngap service based interface profile.  AMF

state.description: Enable/disable releasing of the N2 connection

value.description: If enabled, defines the time the AMF waits before releasing the N2 connection after a NAS procedure; Default: 5000; Units: milliseconds

relocationPrepTimer.description: Time that the AMF waits for the target gNodeB to respond to the handover request in an N2 based handover. Default: 3000; Unit: milliseconds

relocationOverallTimer.description: Time that the AMF waits for the handover notify from the target gNodeB. Default: 5000; Unit: milliseconds

handoverResourceReleaseTimer.description: Time that the AMF waits before releasing the N2 connection on the source gNodeB during an N2 based handover procedure. Default: 2000; Unit: milliseconds

waitForMobilityRegistrationTimer.description: Time that the AMF waits for a mobility registration after an intra-AMF relocation with TAI list change or after an inter-AMF relocation. Default: 5000; Unit: milliseconds

signalingRateControlInitialRegistrationR.description: Defines the maximum rate per second at which the applicable messages may be processed by an AMF Call Control microservice.  The value disable indicates that rate control functionality is disabled.

value.description: If enabled, Unit: messages per second

signalingRateControlAction.description: Defines the action to be taken when the signaling rate control limit has been exceeded. Default: reject.  Ignore: Do not send a response to the UE.  Reject: Send a registration reject to the UE with cause 22 (congestion)

t3346.description: A random number between t3346-low and t3346-high is included in the initial registration reject message as defined by 3GPP TS 24.501 section 8.2.9, and may be used by the UE to re-send the request after the specified time

state.description: The value disable indicates that the T3346 value is not included in the initial registration reject message

low.description: Defines the lower end of the range for the T3346 value sent to the UE.

high.description: Defines the higher end of the range for the T3346 value sent to the UE. Must be greater than 'low'

pagingMaxVisitedGnbsTracked.description: Maximum number of visited gNBs to be tracked per UE for paging

pagingVisitedGnbsAllocation.description: Visited gnbs allocation method for paging

retransmissionTimeoutInitial.description: Retransmission Time Out (RTO) initial value. Default: 500; Unit: milliseconds

retransmissionTimeoutMin.description: Retransmission Time Out (RTO) minimum value. Default: 250; Unit: milliseconds

retransmissionTimeoutMax.description: Retransmission Time Out (RTO) maximum value. Default: 2000; Unit: milliseconds

pathMaxRetransmissions.description: Maximum number of consecutive retransmissions over a destination transport address of a peer endpoint before it is marked as inactive. Default: 5

associationInitMaxTransmit.description: Maximum number of times an INIT chunk or a COOKIE ECHO chunk is retransmitted before an endpoint aborts the initialization process and closes the association. Default: 3

associationMaxRetransmissions.description: Maximum number of consecutive retransmissions to a peer before an endpoint considers that the peer is unreachable and closes the association. Default: 6

maxOutStream.description: Specifies the maximum out stream. Default: 11

maxInStream.description: Specifies the maximum in stream. Default: 11

heartbeatInterval.description: Specifies the heartbeat interval. Default: 30; Unit: seconds

rxBufferSize.description: Specifies the receive buffer size. Default: 149000; Unit: bytes

txBufferSize.description: Specifies the transmit buffer size. Default: 149000; Unit: bytes

sackDelay.description: Specifies the SCTP SACK delay value. Disable: 1; Default: 200; Unit: milliseconds

sackFrequency.description: Specifies the SCTP SACK frequency value. Disable: 1; Default: 2; Unit: packets

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the resource.

safeDeploymentPolicy.description: User defined policy for rolling out changes to the running service

safeDeploymentGroup.description: Safe deployment grouping.  Network functions deployed on clusters/NFVIs with the same safe deployment grouping value are managed together

order.description: Order of safe deployment group rollout.  Lower values are rolled out prior to larger values

continuationPolicy.description: Policy to use when continuing a safe deployment rollout from one group to the next.  Manual indicates halt until the user issues the 'safeDeploymentContinue' action.  Immediate indicates no gate - the next group will start the rollout immediately

status.description: During a safe deployment rollout, current status of the SDP group.  Completed indicates the SDP group has completed the rollout.  Processing indicates the SDP group in the process of rolling out the change.  WaitingForUserInput indicates the SDP rollout has completed but cannot continue to the next group until the user issues a 'safeDeploymentContinue' action.  Pending indicates the safe deployment group has not yet started the rollout.

activeSnapshot.description: Resource identifier of the desired active snapshot.  When this parameter is changed the active snapshot will be applied to the running mobile packet core

desiredImageVersions.description: The image versions to be used by specific network function types

desiredImageVersion.description: The desired image version for this type of network function

networkFunctions.description: List of running network functions and their current image

networkFunction.description: Resource identifier of the deployed network function

currentImageVersion.description: The image version this network function is currently running

currentActiveSnapshot.description: Resource identifier of the currently active snapshot applied to this network function

networkFunctionAvailableImages.description: Available images per network function type

availableImages.description: List of available image versions for the specified type

isDefault.description: Whether or not this version is used if the version is not explicitly specified

supportedServices.description: A list of supported services.  If not specified, all apply

fullNetworkName.description: Defines the full network name provided to UE in a configuration update command; Default: 3gppnetwork.  AMF

shortNetworkName.description: Defines the short network name provided to UE in a configuration update command; Default: 3gppnetwork.  AMF

MobilePacketCoreProperties.description: The Mobile Packet Core resource definition.

value.description: A list of Mobile Packet Core instances in a subscription or resource group.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

MobilePacketCoreListResult.description: Response for Mobile Packet Core API service call.

MobilePacketCoreWhatIfSnapshotResponse.description: Allows the validation and visualization of taking a snapshot without taking the snapshot

summaryOfChanges.description: List of objects that have changed (added/delete/modified)

snapshot.description: Snapshot against which to run what-if activate

MobilePacketCoreWhatIfActivateRequest.description: Allows the validation and visualization of activating a specific snapshot without activating it

resourceId.description: Identifier of the Network Function instance

task.description: List of tasks to be run against the specific network function

MobilePacketCoreWhatIfActivateResponse.description: Allows for the validation of creating a snapshot resource without creating the resource

snapshot.description: Snapshot against which the what-if activate operation was run

networkFunctionInstances.description: List of affected network function instances

MobilePacketCoreSafeDeploymentContinueRe.description: Indicates the result of the safe deployment continue action

actionTaken.description: Action taken as a result of the Safe Deployment Continue operation

completedSafeDeploymentGroupName.description: Name of safe deployment group that was completed by this action

currentSafeDeploymentGroupName.description: Name of safe deployment group that was started by this action
